clinical_study.brief_title: Natural History of Pedal Puncture Wounds in Diabetics
clinical_study.official_title: The Natural History of Pedal Puncture Wounds in Diabetics: a Cross-sectional Survey in the Parish of St. James, Jamaica.

collaborator.agency: Private Practice of Dr. Hector Robinson
Private Practice of Dr. Curtis Yeates

brief_summary.textblock: There are no evidence (research) based guidelines for treatment of early, closed puncture wounds of the feet in diabetics. Surgeons usually see only the limb- and life-threatening consequences of puncture wounds of the feet in diabetics, and are therefore tempted to advocate more aggressive, preemptive, invasive primary treatment for all such wounds, assuming, from this blinkered perspective that all such wounds progress to serious infection. This study is designed to determine the natural history of puncture wounds of the feet in diabetics, specifically, whether all become infected or whether some do heal without any surgical intervention. It requires administration of a questionnaire to 188 known diabetics attending 11 selected outpatient health care centers in the parish of St. James, Jamaica.

arm_group.description: Diabetics in the parish of St. James, Jamaica

study_pop.textblock: Diabetics attending 3 public hospital outpatient clinics, 6 public Health Center primary care clinics and 2 private Internist's clinics.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetic
- 15 years and older
- Resident in the parish of St. James, Jamaica
Exclusion Criteria:
- Impairment of conscious level or mental status such that autonomy is compromised
